ManPage.description: Site and Platform Customization Adminstration Tool

ManPage-Description.p: The sapcat command is used to build Customize scripts for packages. It can also directly build the package from the SapCat description files.

ManPage-Section.title: OPERATION
ManPage-Section.p: The sapcat command has several modes of operation, depending on the command line. The modes are:

dd.p: Check that the {:sapcat:} description files are syntactically correct, that all files referenced by the {:sapcat:} description files actually exist, and that symbols being substituted actually exist.

Customize the package. If the -gui flag is specified, then a graphical user interface is created to select options. OPTIONS control customization values. The sapcat customize command is equivalent to running the Customize script, except it is run directly from the SapCat description files, and provides additional features (such as the GUI).

Create the files needed to support customization of the package. One file is the Customize script, a Bourne-shell script that can be used to customize the package. This command creates the Makefile.in files, which are needed to build the package. It scans sources for symbols that are defined by tests, and assembles the directory of test scripts.
Generate a glossary of symbols defined in the set of unit files.

ManPage-Section.title: BUGS
ManPage-Section.p: The major defect is that the {:sapcat:} system is still vaporware.
